emuInput.TitMainTitle: Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald hearing discrimination case against bartender Harry Kaczmarek (on right) of Master's Grille, Neville Island, with victims Mack Johnson and James Ramsey on left and Kaczmarek's attorney David Friedman in center
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper May 25, 1957 pg. 3, reads: "Guilty of Discrimination! - After Mack Johnson and James Ramsey (left) testified that they were denied service at Master's Grille in Neville Island on May 8, bartender Harry Kaczmarek (third from left), the defendant, was found guilty of violating the anti-discrimination law by Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald (extreme right). Atty. David Friedman represented Kaczmarek. - Harris Photo."
